bibl.title: The Economies of Hellenistic Societies, Third to First Centuries BC.

bibl.seg: CRISCUOLO Lucia, Observations on the Economy in Kind in Ptolemaic Egypt.
Zosia H. ARCHIBALD, John K. DAVIES and Vincent GABRIELSEN (Edd.), The Economies of Hellenistic Societies, Third to First Centuries BC (Oxford, 2011) pp. 166-176.

In Ptolemaic Egypt, the interrelationship between an economy in kind and a monetary economy was much more developed and intricate than is commonly stated, and involved Egyptians as well as Greeks. The very predominance of agriculture in the Egyptian economy allowed and compelled the Egyptian population to enter definitively the world of money.
